title: GameDev with Haxe and HaxeFlixel
description: A series of Haxe and HaxeFlixel related videos by gamefromscratch.

videos.title: 1. Getting Started
videos.description:
Welcome to the very first post on using Haxe and HaxeFlixel to develop 2D games. We are going to look at all facets of Haxeflixel development.

This particular tutorial covers getting your Haxe tools up and running, then installing and configuring the HaxeFlixel libraries and tools.

The text version of this tutorial is available here:
http://www.gamefromscratch.com/post/2017/03/13/HaxeFlixel-Tutorial-Getting-Started.aspx

videos.title: Haxe with Visual Studio Code
videos.description:
This optional tutorial, as part of the Haxe and HaxeFlixel tutorial series, shows how to setup and use Visual Studio Code for Haxe development. This includes installing the editor, configuring the Haxe add-on, configuring builds and running your code from VSCode.

The text version is available here:
http://www.gamefromscratch.com/post/2017/03/15/HaxeFlixel-Tutorial-Getting-Started-With-Visual-Studio-Code.aspx

videos.title: 2. Hello World
videos.description:
In this tutorial we finally jump into some HaxeFlixel code. We create our first project and look at how program flow works in our game.

The text version of this tutorial including code is available at:
http://www.gamefromscratch.com/post/2017/03/17/HaxeFlixel-Tutorial-Hello-World.aspx

videos.title: 3. Sprites
videos.description:
In this tutorial we start getting into 2D graphics by covering sprites. We have two examples, one of a procudurally generated graphic and the other loaded from an image file. The text version of this tutorial including the code is available at:
http://www.gamefromscratch.com/post/2017/03/20/HaxeFlixel-Tutorial-Sprites.aspx

videos.title: 4. Keyboard Input
videos.description:
In our ongoing Haxe and HaxeFlixel tutorial series, today we are going to cover input handling. The code for this example is available here:
http://www.gamefromscratch.com/post/2017/03/30/HaxeFlixel-Tutorial-Keyboard-Input.aspx

videos.title: 5. Mouse Input
videos.description:
In this part of the ongoing Haxe and HaxeFlixel tutorial series we look at handling mouse input. We look at two methods, polled and event driven.

The text based version is available here:
http://www.gamefromscratch.com/post/2017/04/06/HaxeFlixel-Tutorial-Mouse-Input.aspx

videos.title: 6. Cameras
videos.description:
In this video we look at creating cameras, setting the world boundaries, following a game object, playing special effects and even creating a splitscreen game.

The text version with source code is available at:
http://www.gamefromscratch.com/post/2017/04/17/HaxeFlixel-Tutorial-Cameras.aspx

videos.title: 7. Sprite Animation
videos.description:
The next part in our ongoing HaxeFlixel tutorial series, today we cover sprite animation.

The code for this tutorial is available at:
http://www.gamefromscratch.com/post/2017/04/21/HaxeFlixel-Tutorial-Sprite-Animation.aspx

videos.title: 8. Sound and Music
videos.description:
In this tutorial we look at playing back sound and music in HaxeFlixel, including sound effects, music, positional audio and more.

The code is available at:
http://www.gamefromscratch.com/post/2017/04/26/HaxeFlixel-Tutorial-Sound-and-Music.aspx
